metadata.titel_preek: Epiphany and the Baptism of the Lord

locutie.beschrijving: The preacher provides an exegetical overview of Gideon's call, Peter's catch of fish, and the prophecies of Second Isaiah regarding the Babylonian exile and the Suffering Servant.
locutie.exegetische_kwaliteit: High. Strong historical-critical and literary awareness of the text's original context.

illocutie.beschrijving: Primarily explaining the nature of 'holy dread' and the logic of grace, shifting toward the end of each section into direct address.
voorbeelden: The fear of God is the beginning of wisdom because it cannot come about unless God is present.
Jesus stoops down to us in our miserable condition.
Fear not: for, behold, I bring you good tidings.

perlocutie.beoogd_effect: To move the hearer from a sense of deservingness or self-improvement to a state of 'holy dread' and receptive comfort.
perlocutie.pneumatologisch_bewustzijn: Implicit in the liturgical prayers, but largely absent from the sermon body.

voorbeelden: Gideon is not in the least a mighty man of valor.
The Babylonians were a great and powerful culture.
Notice the most radical announcement here.
I think this is supposed to be funny.
The next words that you hear will be: Fear not.
He puts redemption into our blanket.
commissieven.kwaliteit: Moderate. Often framed as 'God does this' (Assertive) rather than 'God does this for you now' (Commissive).

declaratieven.autoriteit: The preacher relies on biblical quotes for declarations rather than speaking in the first-person ministerial 'I' or direct 'You are'.

indicatoren: Extensive retelling of the Gideon narrative.
Historical explanation of the Babylonian exile.
constatief_surplus_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The hearer becomes a spectator of biblical history rather than a participant in a divine encounter.

missende_elementen: Present-tense address of the Spirit's work

toezegging_check.kwaliteit_toezeggen: Strong in imagery, but often deferred to the biblical text's voice.
voorbeelden: He puts redemption into our blanket.

tweede_persoon.gebruik: Direct address used to diagnose sin ('You and I are deep in sin') and offer comfort.

derde_persoon.gebruik: Dominates the narrative retelling and theological exposition.
derde_persoon.distantie_effect: Creates a 'lecture' feel for the first 60% of each section.

tijdloos_present.gebruik: Theological definitions of grace and sin.

actueel_present.gebruik: The 'irruption of grace' in daily life.

foutief_patroon.beschrijving: The sermon avoids moralistic 'Assertive -> Directive' traps.

sacramenteel_patroon.beschrijving: Moves from Assertive (Exegesis) to Commissive (The Promise) to Directive (Count yourself blessed).
voorbeelden: Jesus stoops down... He just gives the gift... Count yourself blessed.
sacramenteel_patroon.kwaliteit: Good, but the transition is late in the sermon.

voorbeelden_goede_verhouding: The God who terrifies is also the one who loves us... If you come to know the fear... count yourself blessed.

diagnostische_evaluatie.diagnose_toelichting: The sermon is deeply rooted in the Gospel indicative, focusing on the unmerited nature of grace, but spends excessive time 'talking about' the mechanics of grace rather than 'performing' the gift.

sterke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: He puts redemption into our blanket.
sterke_punten.effect: Creates a vivid, present-tense sense of receiving grace.

zwakke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: The Babylonians were a great and powerful culture...
zwakke_punten.probleem: Historical lecture delays the 'event' of the Word.

diagnostische_evaluatie.gebeuren_toelichting: It becomes an event in the final third, but the first two thirds are primarily informational.
diagnostische_evaluatie.sacramentele_toelichting: The preacher describes the sacrament of the Word but hesitates to speak as the mouth of God (Declarative).

openbaringsleer.god_als_spreker: God is described as the speaker in the text, but the preacher rarely adopts the persona of God's herald.
openbaringsleer.prediker_als_mandataris: The preacher acts more as a witness/teacher than a mandatory.
tekstueel_bewijs: The prophet opens his ministry by addressing the people...

pneumatologie.geest_rol_erkend: Only in the formal liturgical prayers.
pneumatologie.perlocutie_theologie: Implicitly left to the 'irruption of grace'.

sacramentstheologie.preek_als_genademiddel: The sermon describes grace as a gift, but the sermon itself is not explicitly framed as the delivery of that gift.
sacramentstheologie.epifanisch_taalgebruik: Strong imagery of fire and light.
tekstueel_bewijs: An irruption of grace—an angel sitting under a tree...

aanbevelingen.werkwoord_audit_samenvatting: Shift from past-tense narrative verbs to present-tense performative verbs.

specifieke_suggesties.huidige_formulering: God is opposed to our selfishness.
specifieke_suggesties.voorgestelde_revisie: Today, God stands against your selfishness, yet He stands for you.
specifieke_suggesties.verschil: Moves from a general truth to a present encounter.

toezegging_versterking.probleem: The promise is often quoted as something Isaiah said, rather than something the preacher says now.
toezegging_versterking.suggestie: Use the 'I' of the office to deliver the 'You' of the promise.
voorbeeldzinnen: I announce to you today: your warfare is accomplished.

adressering_verbetering.suggestie: Interweave the 'You' earlier in the narrative retelling.
voorbeeldzinnen: Like Gideon, you are hiding in your own hidden spots today.

indicatief_imperatief_herstel.probleem: The balance is actually quite good; the indicative is the clear foundation.
indicatief_imperatief_herstel.suggestie: Maintain this but make the indicative more performative.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: The sermon is theologically rich and beautifully written; increasing the illocutionary force will transform this from a great lecture into a transformative event.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_schulz_von_thun: SAT reveals that the preacher isn't just sending a 'message' about grace, but is attempting to 'be' the means through which grace irrupts.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retoriek: The power here is not in the 'blanket' metaphor's beauty, but in the Commissive act of God giving the gift through the word.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_SAT: SAT identifies that the 'fear' described is a perlocutionary effect that requires a Declarative cause.

kernzinnen_analyse.zin: He puts redemption into our blanket.
kernzinnen_analyse.effectiviteit: High - this is the sacramental peak.

appendices.notities: The sermon functions as a 'theology of the event' rather than the 'event' itself for the majority of its duration.
